DrugInfoMetaData.DrugInfoDescription: Mitomycin is an antibiotic used as a chemotherapy drug. It stops or slows the growth of cancer cells and other rapidly growing cells by damaging their DNA.

Section.Title: Use in Cancer
Section.Para: Mitomycin is approved to be used alone or with other drugs to treat:

ItemizedList.ListItem: Gastric (stomach) and pancreatic adenocarcinoma that is locally advanced or has metastasized (spread to other parts of the body). It is used in patients whose disease has not gotten better with other types of treatment.
Urothelial cancer in the upper urinary tract. It is given directly into the ureter or kidney as a treatment for adults with low-grade disease. This use is approved for the Jelmyto brand of mitomycin.

Section.Para: Mitomycin is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.
